intro: Schizostephanus somaliensis, commonly known as the Somali starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a star-like appearance, which gives it its common name. Schizostephanus somaliensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
